body.p:
His Excellency Thomas E Bramlette Esq
Govenor of Kentucky
Your Petitioner the undersigned would respectfully represent that at the present November term 1865, he was fined by a Jury of his Magoffin County Sixty Dollars for Tipling

Your petitioner would state that the fine was found against him for selling spirits under the following circumstances, he ^had^ been from home, and was returning with some Spirits, which was intended for family purposes, when he met a parcel of soldiers who found that he had spirits and called upon Petitioner to let hem have some, your Petitioner being somewhat afraid to deny them and as he supposed they would "press" his brandy if he did not let hem have it he let them have a small quantity not expecting to receive anything for, it but the generosity of one or two soldiers in the squad was such that they passed him your petitioner Some money which was received by him, Wherefore he prays your Excellency to remit the above ^fine of Sixty Dollars^ Nov 29th 1865.

I presume really the petition present grounds for pardon -- as the facts are about as stated
J, S, Dury
Comth Aty,
We Join in the above petition with Mr Arnett and ask for the remission of his fine above

S. W. Mcguire
Wiley Gullet
